sec.p: Samples taken throughout the organic clays (Unit 4) mostly yielded sparse, fragmentary and indeterminable insect remains. However, bulk samples (∼5 kg wet weight) from the detritus muds (Unit 3) exposed in a foreshore trench ( Fig. 3) produced fossil Coleoptera that were well enough preserved to enable some taxa to be identified. The insect remains were recovered from the sediment using the method outlined by Coope (1986). Altogether 65 coleopteran taxa were recognised of which 47 could be determined to species level ( Table 4). Seven taxa no longer live in the British Isles.
